page.title: 04Botanic Gardens:Contents
page.content: The limestone rock garden is one of the main features added to the 19th century garden during the expansion after the 2nd world war. The planting is geographical with sections for S.Africa,Australasia,Asia,Europe and N.America,and many of the plants grow- ing there are of known wild origin. The sandstone garden contains lime hating plants such as members of the heath family Ericaceae. The original rock garden dates from about 1860 (one of the earliest in the country) and is now the Terraced garden. It contains a collection of shrubs and dwarf conifers. Many species of ducks live on the lake which was excavated from an old gravel pit and is fed by a small stream from Hobson's conduit. 17 glass houses contain the more delicate plants-the Palm house is 45 feet high!
